query: How does the spectroscopic survey of faint lensed galaxies in the core of the galaxy cluster AC114 extend the work of Natarajan et al and motivate further research on the faint end of the luminosity function of high redshift galaxies?

citation_function_classification.justification: The query seeks to understand how the spectroscopic survey of faint lensed galaxies in the core of the galaxy cluster AC114 extends the work of Natarajan et al and motivates further research on the faint end of the luminosity function of high redshift galaxies. It asks for both background and motivation, which are relevant to understanding the context and purpose of the research.
